name: Running
instructions: Go for a jog or run at a steady pace for 20-30 minutes to elevate your heart rate and improve cardiovascular endurance.

name: Jump Rope
instructions: Jump rope continuously for 10-15 minutes, focusing on maintaining a consistent pace and rhythm.

name: Cycling
instructions: Pedal on a stationary bike or ride a bicycle outdoors for 30-45 minutes, adjusting resistance as needed.

name: High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT)
instructions: Perform a series of intense exercises with short rest intervals, such as burpees, jumping jacks, and mountain climbers, for 15-20 minutes.

name: Swimming
instructions: Swim laps using different strokes for an overall body workout and improved cardiovascular fitness.

name: Russian Twists
instructions: Sit on the floor, lean back slightly, and twist your torso from side to side while holding the weight.

name: Bicycle Crunches
instructions: Lie on your back, lift your legs off the ground, and bring one knee towards your chest while simultaneously twisting your torso to touch the opposite elbow.

name: Side Plank
instructions: Support your body on one elbow and feet, keeping your body straight and hold the position for 30-60 seconds on each side.

name: Hanging Leg Raises
instructions: Hang from a bar and lift your legs up towards your chest, then lower them down slowly without swinging.

name: Woodchoppers
instructions: Stand sideways to the cable machine or anchor a resistance band, then pull the handle diagonally across your body as if you are chopping wood.

name: Bench Press
instructions: Lie on a bench, grip the barbell or dumbbells, and lower the weight to your chest before pressing it back up.

name: Push-Ups
instructions: Assume a plank position, lower your body by bending your elbows, and then push back up.

name: Dumbbell Flyes
instructions: Lie on a flat bench with dumbbells in hand, extend your arms out to your sides, and then bring them back up, hugging an imaginary tree.

name: Chest Dips
instructions: Support your body on parallel bars, lower yourself by bending your elbows, and then push back up.

name: Cable Chest Press
instructions: Stand facing the cable machine, grab the handles, and press them forward while keeping your arms parallel to the ground.

name: Bicep Curls
instructions: Hold the dumbbells or barbell with palms facing up, curl the weight towards your shoulders, and then lower it back down.

name: Tricep Dips
instructions: Support your body on parallel bars, lower yourself by bending your elbows, and then push back up.

name: Hammer Curls
instructions: Hold dumbbells with palms facing inward, curl the weights towards your shoulders, and then lower them back down.

name: Skull Crushers
instructions: Lie on a bench with a barbell, lower the weight towards your forehead, and then extend your arms back up.

name: Preacher Curls
equipment: Preacher Curl Bench, Dumbbell or EZ-Bar
instructions: Sit on the preacher curl bench, hold the weight with palms facing up, and curl it towards your shoulders.

name: Deadlifts
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, bend at the hips and knees, and lift the weight while keeping your back straight.

name: Pull-Ups
instructions: Hang from a bar with an overhand grip, pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, and then lower yourself down.

name: Seated Cable Rows
instructions: Sit at a cable machine, hold the handles, and pull them towards your abdomen, squeezing your shoulder blades together.

name: One-Arm Dumbbell Rows
instructions: Place one knee and hand on a bench, hold a dumbbell in the other hand, and pull it towards your abdomen.

name: Supermans
instructions: Lie face down, extend your arms and legs off the ground, and lift them as high as you can to engage your lower back.

name: Shoulder Press
instructions: Sit on a bench or stand, hold the weights at shoulder height, and press them upward until your arms are fully extended.

name: Lateral Raises
instructions: Stand with dumbbells by your sides, raise them out to your sides until they are parallel to the ground, and then lower them back down.

name: Front Raises
instructions: Hold dumbbells in front of your thighs, raise them straight up to shoulder height, and then lower them back down.

name: Upright Rows
instructions: Hold the barbell or dumbbells with palms facing your body, pull them up towards your chin, and then lower them back down.

name: Arnold Press
instructions: Start with dumbbells at shoulder height, rotate them as you press overhead, and then reverse the motion on the way down.

name: Squats
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, lower your body by bending your knees, and then return to the starting position.

name: Lunges
instructions: Take a step forward, lower your body until both knees are bent at 90-degree angles, then push back up to the starting position.

name: Leg Press
instructions: Sit on a leg press machine, push the weight away by extending your legs, and then return to the starting position.

name: Step-ups
instructions: Step onto a box or step with one leg, push through your heel to stand on top, and then step back down.

name: Romanian Deadlifts
instructions: Hold the barbell or dumbbells with palms facing your body, hinge at the hips, and lower the weight down while keeping your back straight.

name: Calf Raises
instructions: Stand on a calf raise machine or on the edge of a step, rise up on your toes, and then lower back down.

name: Seated Calf Raises
instructions: Sit on a calf raise machine or a bench, place the balls of your feet on the platform or weights, and then raise your heels.

name: Jump Rope
instructions: Jump rope continuously for 10-15 minutes, focusing on maintaining a consistent pace and rhythm.

name: Box Jumps
instructions: Stand in front of a box or platform, jump onto it, and then step back down.

name: Calf Stretch
instructions: Stand near a wall or on a step, place one foot back with the heel on the ground, and lean forward to stretch your calf muscles.
